meanings.definition: A hospital for those with infectious diseases.
meanings.sent1: The old lazaretto was where sick people went to get better.
meanings.sent2: The lazaretto was filled with patients receiving treatment for various illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The lazaretto was so busy that even the nurses had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned lazaretto stood as a haunting reminder of past epidemics.
meanings.sent5: The smell of disinfectant in the lazaretto lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: A quarantine station for travelers or goods.
meanings.sent1: The lazaretto inspected all incoming goods for signs of contamination.
meanings.sent2: Travelers had to pass through the lazaretto before entering the city.
meanings.sent3: The lazaretto workers wore protective gear to handle the potentially hazardous cargo.
meanings.sent4: The lazaretto gates stood as a barrier against the spread of disease.
meanings.sent5: The lazaretto was a crucial checkpoint for preventing the spread of infections.

meanings.definition: A building or area used for isolating people or animals with contagious diseases.
meanings.sent1: The lazaretto was surrounded by high walls to prevent escape.
meanings.sent2: Animals with contagious diseases were kept in a separate section of the lazaretto.
meanings.sent3: The lazaretto was like a fortress, keeping the sickness contained within.
meanings.sent4: The gates of the lazaretto symbolized the divide between health and illness.
meanings.sent5: The sounds of coughing echoed through the empty corridors of the lazaretto.
